output:
Tools available:
1. calculate_distance(p1, p2): Calculate Euclidean distance between two points
2. calculate_direction_angle(p1, p2): Calculate direction angle from p1 to p2 (in degrees)

Definitions of Spatial Relations:
1. Equals: Two polygons have identical vertices (position and order may differ)
2. Contains: Polygon A contains polygon B if all vertices of B are inside A
3. Within: Polygon A is within polygon B if all vertices of A are inside B
4. Overlaps: Two polygons partially overlap - at least one vertex is inside while at least one vertex is outside
5. Disjoint: Two polygons are completely separate - all vertices are outside of each other

Method to determine if a point is inside a polygon:
For point P and polygon ABCD, calculate the direction angles from P to each vertex
Sum up the angle changes around the polygon. If the sum is ±360°, P is inside; otherwise, P is outside

→ The two polygons have the exact same set of vertices
→ Relation: Equals
